ColecoVision in the ClassicGaming Museum Z80 Game Machines

Game Machines based on Z80 Family

If there are popular Game Machines based on Z80 family, you know of or you would like to point to, please tell me, or - even better - contact me if you are ready to maintain any "z80gm*" sub page not yet existing, nicely fitting into my Z80 series of documents.

SEGA GameGear

SEGA

  • Sega Genesis contains a Z80 processor. The main processor is a Motorola 68000 processor running at 8 Mhz, and it has a Z80 coprocessor to do background tasks such as audio among other things.
  • the Sega Master System and the Sega Master System II (basically the same as the master system, except that it does not include the IC card interface), and the Sega Power Base converter (an adapter that allowed the use of Sega Master system games on the Sega Genesis) also used the Z-80 microprocessor
